headline: Pumpkin Brownies
description: Pumpkin brownies are the perfect marriage of two favorite batters! Decadent chocolate and pumpkin-nut, swirled together for rich, fall flavor in each bite!

video.description: Pumpkin + chocolate = the best of both dessert worlds!
video.name: Pumpkin Brownies

name: Pumpkin Brownies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch square baking pan.
Stir flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl.

Stir sugar, melted butter, and vanilla together in a large bowl. Add one egg and mix with a spoon until well incorporated. Repeat to add remaining 2 eggs, mixing well after each addition. Gradually add flour mixture and stir the batter until evenly moistened. Pour 1/2 of the batter back into the medium bowl that held the flour mixture.
Stir chocolate chips and cocoa into one bowl of batter. Stir pumpkin puree, walnuts, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg into the second bowl of batter.

Spread 1/2 of the chocolate batter into the bottom of the prepared baking pan, and follow with 1/2 of the pumpkin batter. Repeat the two layers once more. Drag a kitchen knife or small spatula gently through the layers in a swirling motion to create a marbled appearance.
Bake in the preheated oven until the brownies begin to pull away from the sides of the pan, and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan before cutting into 16 squares.

review.reviewBody: I made these for my mother-in-law who loves pumpkin, and my father-in-law who loves chocolate. Only two things I did differently was make them in a 9x13 pan and the bottom layer was the only one with chocolate chips. Then I alternated pumpkin and chocolate. They were a huge hit! Once they were cool I put them in the fridge; I preferred them that way. This recipe is going into my "must have for fall" binder!
These are the perfect blend of chocolate and pumpkin. Perfect texture. Perfect moisture level. So, so good!
They looked good and I followed the recipe exactly but the pumpkin layer came out really kind of mushy. The flavor is great! I'll make them again but will not marble them, Ill mix it all in one bowl.

I couldn't decide whether I wanted swirled or layered, so I did both and at the last second I realized I forgot the walnuts, so I quickly put some in part of it (some on swirled side, some on layered side.) I followed the directions and did repeating layers for swirled, but just one thicker layer of each on the layered side. All versions were very moist and delicious, but overall I would say I personally liked layers better as to me it seemed like I could taste all the flavors more. I liked it with nuts slightly more, but it was delicious both ways.

These are very tasty. I made two recipes: one without nuts where I didn't swirl the batters, and one with nuts where I tried to swirl the batters. I liked the recipe with nuts better, but I don't think the swirling is what made the difference.
very Yummy

The combination of brownie and pumpkin bar is surprisingly tasty! I somehow didn't think the two would mix well despite them being delicious in their own rights. I literally couldn't stop eating them. Fair warning for those of you on a diet or healthy lifestyle! Also very rich and decadent.
Delicious! Only change I substituted pumpkin pie spice doubled the recipe and baked in Nordic ware skull plan. Got 12 skulls. Kids loved it.

Needed unique ideas to use up homemade pumpkin purée, as my family was tired of the usual breads and soups. I am skeptical of mixing other flavors in brownies, but am so grateful I did! The rich spices complimented the chocolate perfectly, making an indulgent fall treat. Could not stop eating them!
These are a fall favorite for my family and friends!
I didn't make any changes and we loved the recipe. I would definitely make it again.
These are easy-to-make, quite rich, delicious pumpkin brownies. I followed the directions pretty much to a T. Baked for 40 min.
Rave reviews from my quality control team. Slight tweak, I added 2 tsps of espresso powder to the brownie mixture. Yummy.
Wow! Super delicious. I loved the balance of spices and chocolate chips. I only used a cup of sugar and it was perfect. Thanks for a great recipe!!! Great texture. Can’t wait to make again!

Added less sugar (only 1/2 cup) and they came out great....to my taste. Like the recipe...good pumpkin flavor in that section (the spices made it so, probably). I did the cupcakes, as pictured, with the recipe.
Made this tonight for a pumpkin carving party. Super moist and delicious. Everyone loved it!
this is amazing! I had to substitute 2 oz of unsweetened chocolate because I ran out of cocoa powder. Turned out amazing!!!!

One of the best desserts I’ve made and I’ve been baking for 50 years! A few changes: In addition to baking powder, I added 1/2 tsp baking soda, I reduced sugar to 1 cup, I only had 1/3 cup chocolate chips which is enough, I put all of chocolate layer on bottom of 8”x8” pan with pumpkin layer on top. Instead of folding walnuts into pumpkin layer, I sprinkled 1/2 cup chopped pecans on top. They toasted beautifully. These bars are creamy, rich, delicious. It’s 5 a.m. the day after baking. I’m wondering how long I can resist eating one today.
Doubled this recipe and used a Bundt pan. Only adjustment I did was pumpkin pie spices instead of spices on their own.
Tasty
Great taste. Very moist. I doubled recipe for a 9x13” pan. Worth the extra steps. Company loved it
Looks & tastes Dee lush! Serving with a dollop of vanilla ice cream.

These were good. I changed the recipe because I had no cocoa powder, so I used a little less then 1/2 cup of melted chocolate chips and baked them for about 50 minutes. It tasted a little more like a cake than a brownie. They turned out really good though, and we ate them with fudge ice cream. Yummy! Thanks for the good idea!
Loved these brownies! Only change I made was doubled the recipe to use a 9 x 13” pan.
They were delicious. Moist and very chocolatey. I will make again.
These are delicious and it was pretty easy too! Win win!

These were a big favorite with everyone I shared them with. I baked them in a cupcake pan, for 30 minutes. I probably should've left them in for 5 more minutes, as a few of them had parts of the bottom come off, as those weren't fully set. The comments I received was that they were very moist and delicious. I didn't have walnuts, so used pecans instead, and I used Dutch processed cocoa as well. (and yes, I might use cupcake papers next time, or just extend the time as I mentioned previously.) Will make again!

5 stars for the flavor of these brownies, 2 stars for the hassle of trying to get them out of the mini muffin cups they were baked in. I wanted them to be just like the photo, so I followed one reviewer's suggestions to make them in mini muffin pans. Oh, what a mess! Even though the pan was well greased, it was a horrible mess. They came out in several pieces. The last batch to go into the oven were baked in regular sized muffin pans and worked out much better. The flavors were wonderful though. I will make these again, but probably in the 8 x 8 pan as directed in the recipe.
Mine turned out more like cake rather than a brownie. But they were very tasty!
I’ve made this recipe multiple times over the past two autumns, and every time they’re a hit! I love the way the brownie and pumpkin mix together forming a unique texture.
Made these scrumptious brownies for Thanksgiving, everyone loved them!
I made them in my corn bread muffin pan so needed to go for 40 mins. They are so yummy!
very moist and yummy! my two favorite flavors this time of year!

We added chocolate frosting to the brownies. It’s an excellent recipe. 
Definitely try it.
I made it gluten free and it's fantastic! Combination of 3 gluten free flours, reduced the sugar and eggs. YUM!! This will be a keeper! Thank you!

Absolutely fantastic. I didn’t change a thing. One thing I love about this recipe versus others is how the pumpkin swirl is actual batter that bakes up with the same texture as the brownie, rather than being a more moist swirl. Keeping this recipe to make forever and ever.

Absolutely delicious and so moist! Like others, I use more batter in the chocolate layer, and it does need it. I also did not swirl the layers. Topped with chocolate chips. Just wonderful and not overly sweet! Mine was done in about 35 minutes. Oven times vary. Just start checking it at 30 minutes.

This is good but as noted in other reviews the part with the cocoa gets way to stiff. I split the batter 2/3 chocolate and 1/3pumpkin and added 2 tbsp milk to the chocolate part. I also made a batch with vegetable oil instead of melted butter and that helped you. But good taste overall.
Nice consistency and flavour. Not too “cakey”..

We left out the walnuts because the kids don't like them :( but other than that followed the recipe exactly. They turned out very tasty, moist and rich. A great treat for fall when you are in the mood for pumpkin!
I’ve made it twice and will definitely make it again. Everyone loves them !
Very good, though it took longer to bake than 40 minutes. I left out the spices which gave the top layer more of a walnut flavour, which was what I was going for.
It was delicious! Loved by all
This is my new favorite holiday brownie recipe! I made mini muffins instead of bars. Fabulous!
Not my favorite, but the recipe worked well.
I didnt

This recipe was a big hit at Thanksgiving dinner! It had the flavor of gingerbread with the texture of pound cake. Add some homemade whipping cream. . .wow! The end result was very dense and rich although I couldn't separate the flavor of the brownie layer from the pumpkin layer. I doubled it and left out a few Ts of butter as others had recommended. We didn't miss that butter. I would make it again.
I used Ghirardelli Chocolate Premium Brownie Mix Double Chocolate instead of making brownies. I layered brownie, pumpkin and more brownie. Added pecans and swirled. Fabulous! And easy!! Big hit!
Instead of sugar, I used Stevia. Brownies were awesome.

Mushy...First, as another reviewer said, you have to give more of the batter to the chocolate portion than the pumpkin portion. But either way, it is absolutely not cooked in the center. Might be better as cupcakes.

I followed the recipe as is, except switched out walnuts for pecans cause it's what I had on hand. Unfortunately, I didn't like them. I think it was the cloves, too overpowering for my taste. And the texture didn't work for me either, they were almost mushy. My cousin liked them though and luckily took most off them home so I didn't have to worry about them going to waste. I won't be making these again.

I was so skeptical and worried that it would be dry or not taste good. But it was AMAZING!!!!! so addicting! Perfectly moist. So glad I tried this out. We’re not huge pumpkin fans and we are believers now. I’ll be making this for my work potluck as well. I used pumpkin pie spice instead of the nutmeg, clove and cinnamon and I am glad I did!
Made gluten free with 1/2 c King Arthur measure for measure flour and 1/4 c oat flour. Also cut sugar by 1/4 c, left out the walnuts and added another 1/4 c pumpkin. Yum!
These brownies are delicious and very easy to make!

Very clear recipe. I ended up having to change things up a bit, because I couldn't find pumpkin puree and didn't want to start from scratch. I went with apple sauce and chestnut puree in separate batches all added together in the end, reduced sugar by a third since those are sweeter (probably could've reduced even a bit more).
Yummy. Only thing I may add next time, is anise instead of cloves. Thank you for the recipe.

This was AMAZING. I will definitely make this again. I followed the recipe but added a bit more pumpkin and also baked this in muffin cups rather than a pan - a great way to have easy to-go treats. The flavor is fantastic and the choc chips and nuts add a nice little crunch. The crust is chewy in that brownie-like way. Highly recommend!!
Added more flour, sprinkled with chocolate chips and walmlnuts on top. I would make this again!
What a perfect combo of my two favorites, chocolate and pumpkin! Didn't change anything. Will make again and again!

I made these as written but subbing gluten free all purpose flour and omitting walnuts. We just aren't fans of nuts in our brownies. I baked these a minute or two past 45minutes and they turned out perfectly. They were delicious!
I added a vanilla glaze icing on top. Delicious!

Super yummy! However, the brownie batter was very think and difficult to spread, but was super chocolatey and delicious. The brownie portion sank to the bottom while the pumpkin rose to the top, but I poured the batters in multiple layers because I wanted them to be mixed more. It really just ended up being a layer of pumpkin cake on top of a super good brownie.

Oh. My. Word. These are so delish! The only changes I made were due to preference. I simply substituted the nuts for chocolate chips in the pumpkin portion. I also spread nutella on top and sprinkled pecans on top. Yum! A real crowd pleaser!
Really liked the brownie and pumpkin together, quite a surprise. Loved the dark chocolate of the brownie portion. Great recipe that I will make again.

Delicious! These will be a regular in my autumn repertoire now. I baked them in muffin tins and kept a close eye on the time, it was about 21 minutes in our oven. Because of the way I layered the brownies I did have extra pumpkin batter so I just poured it into a greased 8x8-inch pan and baked it that way.
Huge hit at the fall potluck!
Excellent recipe. Many compliments and requests for more. Followed the recipe as written. Will certainly make again and often.

These came out delicious! I used moist brown sugar instead and only 1/2 of what it called for on the recipe. The only downside was that I tried to do these in the muffin tin instead, like it showed in one of the pictures, and that did not work out so well. Brownies are meant to be square, i guess :-)
Excellent! So fudgy and moist!
I liked this! very different I would have never put pumpkin and chocolate together but it was good!
Added 1/2 Teaspoon of ground ginger!
delicious. maybe doubling the recipe and making it in a bigger pan so you get more of the moist inner brownies would make it better.
I cut back the butter to one stick and the sugar to one cup. Turned out great. I think next time I will use 3/4 c of sugar. They are still very sweet.
Very good blend of flavors, and walnuts add perfect crunch!
loved these brownies. these are a keeper.

These are amazingly dense and rich.... amazing recipe. Yes, the batter ratios take a bit of getting used to, but they are absolutely amazing. I cut these into small cubes to serve, as opposed to traditional bars. Yummy!!

This was delicious! It was the perfect brownie. The first time I made it, I used only butter. The second time I used half oil/half butter and it was better. I recommend you guys to use half oil/half butter. I'm making this again!
Made these for Thanksgiving and they were a big hit. a great dessert for the holidays. however instead of a pan we made ours in mini muffins.

I made these for Thanksgiving dinner, but omitted the nuts and used dark chocolate chips. I didn't stir through the chocolate and pumpkin as I prefer the 2 layers. My 1 1/2 year old and 2 1/2 year old grandchildren devoured them! The spices are perfect to make the pumpkin stand out (love the cloves), and the balance of chocolate to pumpkin is perfect. I also loved the texture of the chocolate chips in the brownie batter. I made one recipe and it made 12 tall cupcakes. You could easily make up to 18 cupcakes and they would still be big enough. I cooked for 15 minutes, then checked every 5 minutes. As it was, 12 tall cupcakes required 25 minutes at 350 degrees. I will definitely make these again and again.

Fantastic dessert! I made it for our staff at school and everyone wanted to come back for seconds! I followed the recipe exactly as written but put into muffin pans and baked about 25 min. Sprinkled powdered sugar on top with a drizzle of melted chocolate chips
This an excellent Fall Brownie recipe. My family really enjoyed it. I did not substitute or change a thing. YUMMY

These were truly addictive! I made mini-muffins for a work pitch-in. I used mini choc chips instead of the regular sized chips. Suggestion: putting the pumpkin mixture in first, then the brownie makes it easier to remove the muffins. I baked them at 350 for 9 min, sprinkled a small amount of pecan chips/mini choc chips on top, then baked for another 9 minutes. Let them cool for about 15 min. Very cute presentation and so, so, SO delicious!
This was a great brownie. I made a few changes:

I made these to take to work and they are a big hit! Mine didn't come out as pretty as yours, but I did most of them in mini muffin papers and didn't swirl. I probably should have put the pumpkin portion on top instead of the brownie part, but it's fine. I doubled the recipe and used 5 eggs instead of 6. I added a couple of shakes of ground ginger to the pumpkin batter, and used pecans instead of walnuts as one of my co-workers is not a walnut fan. They have a very nice texture and are very tasty.

Bakery-quality, wonderful Fall recipe! Made exactly as written, however, added 1/2 tsp ginger as well. Flavor combination brought to mind moist, "chocolatey pumpkin pie". Baking time and temperature were "right on" for my convection oven. Good flavor, same day; better flavor the next day; BEST flavor the day after. Recommend cooling after baking and then storing (covered) in refrigerator at least 1-2 days. Bring to room temperature before serving. Thanks for sharing!

Delicious and even better a day or two after baking. My 10 year old daughter made them and enjoyed the challenge of two batters! Four stars because bake time was too long for muffins. Although pictured in photo, there was no time noted in recipie for muffins and they started to burn. Check at 25 and 30 minutes.

Loved this. I made it in the muffin tins and did half with walnuts half without. It made approximately 18 brownies when I did it in the standard size muffin tins. Due to the size I did not layer as the recipe mentioned but rather did one layer of chocolate one with pumpkin and then used an offset spatula to twist half of it within each cup to get it somewhat mixed. As others wrote, I went ahead and did about a 2/5ths 3/5ths split on the batter mix with more with the pumpkin. Overall, it was fantastic. Will definitely make them again!

Nice dessert for fall. I doubled this and poured into a 9x13 pan, took about 45 min. to bake and ended up being more cake-like. However, I made the mistake of not adding the flour until I had divided the batter in half and had added my cocoa/chips to some of it. This worked out well though as I had read where some thought the cocoa half was too thick and the pumpkin half too thin. So, I just added less flour to the cocoa half and more to the pumpkin half to work that out. I realized the cocoa half was still pretty thick so I thinned it out a bit with an extra 2/3 C. of pumpkin puree. Oh, I only used 2 C. of the 3 C. of sugar called for in the recipe. Next time I would probably decrease that to 1 1/2 C and decrease the chips to 3/4 C as well. Our family doesn't like our desserts too sweet. Ended up with a scrumptiously moist fall dessert!
Moist and gooey. Perfect for the pumpkin and brownie lover. Added extra cocoa powder for a deeper chocolate flavour.
My family did not like these. The flavors were competing and just didn't go well together. Everyone was scraping the brownie part to eat it
These are great! Recipe is perfect as is... or substitute butterscotch chips for richer flavour.

I made these today for my kids and husband as a treat for not making any treats for a while. I've had this saved for quite a while and really wanted to make as is but couldn't justify the full amount of sugar for a 8x8 pan... My teeth hurt thinking about that! I only used 3/4 cup and the end result told me that was enough. I decided to sprinkle the top with some remaining dark chocolate chips and the walnuts (instead of mixing with the batter). They are a really beautiful fall brownie. I was told by my kids that there was too much spices.. And it over took the chocolate flavor.. But the one bit I had.. I really loved. 
Next time I make I will try with whole wheat flour, coconut sugar, and try coconut oil instead of the butter, and use a full teaspoon of baking powder. My recommendation for this brownie is please cut down on the sugar... It's way overboard.

I don't understand the good results: I left mine in for ten minutes longer and the middle was still mushy. Is this enough flour?

I used wheat flour and white chocolate chips instead.

The flavor is great, just didn't turn out solid.

I followed this recipe to the T and it came out great! I brought it into work, and between the 3 of us that were on staff, almost the whole pan disappeared. Very much enjoyed it. The comments I got said they were very rich, but also very satisfying. Will definitely be making these again this fall!

Loved and followed the suggestion of adding Adobo for extra kick. Even before doing so it was delicicious.

Made the lamb kabobs recipe on this site into meatballs and set one large in each bowl of soup with a drizzle of yogurt.

Very yummy...will make again and again.
Reduced butter to 1/2c. Rounded up cinnamon to 1t. Split batter so there was more for chocolate batter, and used rounded 1/4c. cocoa to compensate.
Amazing brownie! I used white chocolate chips in then pumpkin half and they turned out great!

I did reduce the cloves, but the rest was pretty much per the recipe. I was worried when I started cutting them when they where still a little too warm. It didn't look like the pumpkin was going to set, but once cooled they were perfect. I will make this recipe again. Thanks.

This was sooooo good! My girls gobbled them up. I left out the nuts because we did not have any. I put in muffin tins with liners (sprayed them ) to make clean up easier, decreased the butter a bit, decreased sugar a bit. I will definitely make again.
